topics.body:
And now for your nightly science post cause Phantasy Star Online 2 installed improperly thus I had to uninstall and reinstall all over again and it takes fucking forever to install completely:

A couple of weeks ago apparently a new type of memristor was developed that literally does function like a neuron.  This is a massive jump in science because it means vastly better neural network simulations.


You know moore's law?  Ever hear of the phrase "every two years the number of transistors we can fit onto a area doubles?" or what bullshit 24/7 news calls "our technological level doubles every two years?"(as in full of shit).  Apparently Moore's law has been untrue since 2002 and soon will bunk all together.  Apparently the number of transistors we can fit onto a area has been doubling every year and 3/4ths not every two years and they've managed to make transistors that are only a couple atoms wide several years in advance.  Effectively we'll probably have atom sized transistors in 3 years not 5 years.


Ai stuff cause I have a large hardon collider for that and find it smashing (science joke; although it doesn't really fit this particular occasion): anyway you know how I talk about Ai development?  With the development of transistors that use light instead, quantum computing, memristors and it's becoming more of a programming problem than a hardware problem.  It's just a ballpark guess people have estimated but we have about a 70% chance human level intelligent Ai will become a reality somewhere inbetween 2030 and 2045.  It could happen sooner if there is a massive dumping of money into development; which considering how all the tech industries just dump craploads of money into shit that isn't even close to ready yet isn't that crazy.  It could happen later if people start legally banning development and throwing programmers who work on it in jail.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ab48566368721474000fcb#post_55ab48566368721474000fcb
I can understand that.

I don't get upset when it comes to Death battles mostly cuz I try to just enjoy them for what they are. Something fun where you see both the characters beat each other up.

Bonus if your favorite character wins. Bonus Bonus if the fight contains both your favorite characters.

But needless to say I understand what you mean.



"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ab48576368721474000fce#post_55ab48576368721474000fce
Well first of all obviously we saw this coming eons away (AAnd this is why I was mainly like, Why even do this then?) Superman won.

Again. And unlike the last battle superman legit didn't even try like at all.

So after the battle when superman *ZAPS GOKUS BRAIN INTO DUST* they basically go on about how Goku and Superman are two different things.

one's of which Goku though strong has limets.

And Superman where he really isn't meant to be destroyed or killed or even beaten. Fact they even said this is why Superman isn't Death Battle material because as far as we all know, superman is legit unbeatable.

You cant kill superman and he's so powerful he breaks the laws of physics itself.

Superman basically in one comic lifted up a sphere of paper with infinite pages, basically He lifted *LITERALLY INFINITE*.

And he can hear sounds from 900,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000, away which is physically impossible.

Superman is legit, limitless.

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ab4bfb63687214740014ea#post_55ab4bfb63687214740014ea
He does have Limits in that he recents has a new super move that after use turns him normal for 24 hours.

Also he's weak to magic. So if anything someone like Discord or Doctor Strange should be able to kick his ass. (But yet this is superman so who knows)

And he has been killed. But you see even though someone like Doomsday killed him that doesn't mean anything. 

And they compared it to just because Goku got beaten by Ratis doesn't really mean anything.

They both got right back up from it.

Also another thing is superman keeps getting more and more and more and more OP as time goes along.

Basically Superman is the definition of the word OP.
